Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
CAN: Attempt to draw a basic shape that might resemble a fish, potentially with incorrect proportions.
Include a body of water represented as a single colored area, like blue scribbles, to suggest water.
CANNOT: Label parts of the habitat correctly such as rocks or plants (may not include any labels or may label objects unrelated to the habitat).
Accurately show a fish's use of its environment, like finding food or swimming (fish might be drawn incorrectly, outside of water, or without understanding of its needs).
Illustrate other plants or animals that might live in the same habitat (drawing might have a fish alone or with unrelated elements like a cat or a tree by mistake).
Demonstrate how the fish and habitat form a system (student might show no interaction or incorrect elements, such as fish living on land).
